p: When the cells reached 70% confluence, they were exposed to UV radiation using Bio-Link Crosslinker BLX 312/365; Vilber Lourmat, Germany. UVB radiation dose was 300 mJ/cm 2 and was chosen corresponding to 70% cell viability measured by the methyl tetrazolium (MTT) assay [ 32] described in detail below. The distance between cells and lamps was 15 cm, what gave power density at 4.08 mW/cm 2 for UVB (312 nm). Control cells were incubated in parallel without irradiation.
